title: Inspect & Finish
description: Check for defects, clean slag, and finish welds with confidence.
tldr: Inspect the bead for uniformity, clean it, and finish with light grinding only when needed.

sections.title: Visual inspection
sections.body: Look for even bead width, proper tie-in, and minimal spatter. Small defects are easier to fix early.

sections.title: Cleaning slag
sections.body: Chipping and brushing remove slag and reveal the true bead. Clean metal helps you learn faster.

sections.title: Finishing touches
sections.body: Use light grinding only when required. Over-grinding can weaken the joint and remove good weld.

quiz.question: What should you check first after welding?
Why avoid heavy grinding?
quiz.explanation: Too much grinding removes good weld material.

quiz.question: What reveals the true bead?
quiz.explanation: Cleaning exposes the bead for inspection.
